entry.title: Re: SPOT awards - Data anonymization
entry.content:
In our test environment, we mask sensitive employee data, including compensation and bonuses; through data imports. For bonuses, we use the PayComponentNonRecurringImportTemplate available on the Import Employee Data screen.

To streamline this process, a report was created that contains all the necessary template fields for masking bonus data after each environment refresh. Before granting access to others, we ensure that all personally identifiable information (PII) is masked, including: Address, Email, Compensation, Bonus, Date of Birth, Phone Number, etc.

entry.title: Re: How to add a field documentation in a custom analytic...
entry.content:
Hello @Chris101 

Thank you for your question and the screenshot.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the multidimensional report that opens from Custom Analytical Queries doesn’t display @EndUserText.quickInfo in the More Field Help popover. For many custom or calculated fields, you’ll simply see “No Help Available.” The content of that popover depends on the report viewer, not just your CDS annotations. SAP Learning-Working with Multidimensional Reports    SAP Help Portal-EndUserText

What  you should do

  • Put guidance in the query header: add your explanation in Custom Analytical Queries → Query Information → Description so users see it in the report header. SAP Help Portal-EndUserText
  • Use a UI that supports tooltips if you need per-field help:
    • Fiori elements can surface quick info/tooltips via annotations (e.g., @Common.QuickInfo). GitHub
    • In SAP Analytics Cloud, you can add tooltip measures/dimensions on charts/tables. SAP Help Portal-Select Accounts, Measures, and Dimensions
    • SAPUI5 generally treats tooltips as UI-specific; not every control shows them. sapui5.hana.ondemand.com-Discover New Enterprise Grade Horizons

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Newly registered user has old activities
entry.content:
Hello Team!

 

We have noticed that a newly registered user has activities starting from years ago.

Can you please explain this behavior and help us how to get rid off them?

 Thank you


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Newly registered user has old activities
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Activities before the registration data were imported by one of your source connectors.

Only you can know which connector imported those activities.

Old activities can be deleted by Data Retention.

Please note that min Retention Period is 14 days, which means if you set up the correct roles the old activities will be deleted after 14 days.

 

Best Regards,

Tamas

entry.title: Cross-Template Goal Cascading: Has Anyone Solved This in SuccessFactors?
entry.content:
We have recently been made aware of the limitation in SuccessFactors Performance Management where cascading goals across different performance form templates (e.g. Leader vs Office-based forms) isn’t supported, which is creating a disconnect in goal alignment across levels.


Has any organisation implemented a tailored solution or workaround to address this issue? We’re particularly interested in whether custom configurations, template design strategies, or integration approaches (e.g. using shared goal libraries or editable group goals) have been successfully used to bridge this gap.


Any examples or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Sort order of segments in IDOC_DATA_INSERT
entry.content:
This post refers to an ERP 750 system.

I passed several custom segments of different types to the caller of the BADI. Unfortunately they have not been considered. Debugging the standard code, I found out, that the lines have to be of a certain sort order which has to be coherent to the order, in which the segment types appear in the IDOC definition. This coding can be found in LEDI1F09:

* jetzt sind in i_edid4 die zusätzlichen Segmente eingemischt
* die Segmentnummern sind nicht fortlaufend!! - nur die eingemischten
* haben nach der neuen Zählung die richtigen Nummern
* die Hierarchiefelder sind bei den neuen nicht gefüllt
* syntaxprüfung
    perform fa5_syntax_after_insert using i_edidc ident rc.
    if rc eq 0. " dann können die Änderungen abgespeichert und die
                " statussätze entsprechend geschrieben werden
                " vorher nachsehen, ob die Statussätze aus dem vorigen
                " BADI nachträglich geändert werden müssen

So I created a sorter routine that puts the lines in the right order (using the field COUNTER to influence on the order):

    class-methods sort
      importing
        control       type edidc
        input         type tab_idocins
      returning
        value(result) type tab_idocins.

(...)
method sort.
    " for use in implementations of BADI IDOC_DATA_INSERT:
    " make sure the inserted segments come with the same order as
    " in the syntax of the IDOC. Otherwise, they will be
    " rejected by the BADI afterwards
    data count type n length 3.
    call function 'EDI_IDOC_SYNTAX_GET'
      exporting
        pi_idoctyp       = control-idoctp
        pi_cimtyp        = control-cimtyp
      tables
        pt_syntax_table  = syntax_lines
      exceptions
        syntax_not_found = 1                " No entry in EDISYN found
        others           = 2.
    if sy-subrc <> 0.
      result = input.
      return.
    endif.
endmethod.
    sort syntax_lines ascending by parseg nr.
    loop at syntax_lines into data(line).
      loop at input into data(input_line) where segnam = line-segtyp.
        add 1 to count.
        insert value #(
          base input_line
          counter = count
          ) into table result.
      endloop.
    endloop.

In my BADI implementation, I call this method at the end of the implementation of:

  method if_ex_idoc_data_insert~fill.
(...)
      data(entries) = zcl_tool_idoc_segment_sort=>do(
        input = create_entries( )
        control = control ).
     insert lines of entries into table new_entries.
  endmethod.

Maybe I've overseen some standard way to deal with this problem. If so, I would be grateful to know about it.

entry.title: Redeployment of Landing Pages to migrate from Neo to the Cloud Foundry platform
entry.content:
Call to action:

For the migration in the productive system, you must adjust the CDN accordingly and redeploy the existing landing pages and forms. Else those landing pages and form will not work anymore after 2025-12-31.

 

Motivation: 

In SAP Marketing Cloud Customers can use forms and landing pages to collect customer data or trigger registration processes. This functionality will be migrated in the SAP context of migrating Neo scenarios to Cloud Foundry.   

Why are we migrating? 

The multi-cloud foundation has become the strategic focus for SAP BTP because of its significant benefits as compared with the Neo environment, including its principles of openness and freedom of choice in terms of support for multiple infrastructure providers, data centers, and a wide range of runtimes and programming languages. For Neo you can use selected services only and therefore the scenarios on Neo must be migrated to the multi-cloud foundation. Explanation in SAP Help Portal of the migration.

 

Are you affected? 

If you are not using landing pages or forms you do not need to do anything.  If you are using landing pages or forms and you have not republished the landing pages/forms since January 1st, 2022 you are affected.

What you you need to do?

Depending on your use-case you need to carry out the following steps:

Use Case 1: Landing page is hosted by SAP

To migrate from the NEO environment to SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, you must unpublish your landing pages and then publish them again. You do this in the Content Studio app under Landing pages.  After unpublishing,  your landing page is redeployed on the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment.

 

 

Note that the URL of the landing page may change.

 

This depends on whether you use a Content Delivery Network (CDN) provider.

If you do not use your own CDN, the URL will change, and you must update the changed value in your web pages and email templates.

If you use your own CDN, the URL remains stable, however  you must adjust the mapping in the profile of your CDN provider. You can find the URL to which you need to map in the Content Repository Configuration app.

 

Use Case 2: Landing page/form is hosted by you

The downloaded form is hosted by you but you are sending the data to the SAP’s Cloud data buffer as described in Adjusting the JavaScript File.

Please adjust the Base Path parameter according to the latest version of this document.

 

Related Information

Please also see the following blog post Migration of the Simple Content Repository from Neo to the Cloud Foundry platform 

 

What to do in case of issues? 

Please create a ticket on the component CEC-MKT-LPC

I hope you can benefit from the information presented in this blog post. In case of questions or feedback, please feel free to comment on this blog.

entry.title: Re: Issue in SAP B1: add-on disabled, blocking invoice se...
entry.content:
Hi Perla_HernandezPea

It looks like an issue with the add-on setup for the users.

"From the Specify Setup Mode tab, select the default startup mode of this extension, specify the user
preferences, and choose Next.

  • Default Startup Mode: The default startup mode determines how the extension is launched for all users
    that are connected to the company.
  • Automatic - SAP Business One starts the extension automatically. Users can stop automatically
    started add-ons with no impact on SAP Business One. A warning message informs users when the
    extension stops.
  • Manual - SAP Business One does not start the extension automatically. Users can start the extension
    at any time. A message informs users when a manually started extension is stopped.
  • Mandatory - SAP Business One starts the extension automatically. The extension is necessary for the
    successful operation of the SAP Business One application. The application launches the extension at
    start-up and shuts it down if the extension is terminated for any reason. Users cannot start or stop
    mandatory extensions.
  • Disabled - The extension is disabled.

still having issue , create support ticket using component "SBO-EXT-MNG"

Kind Regards
Nidhi 
SAP Support

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA does not support automatic split purchase order by WBS code / storage location
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023  in a company that operates under a centralized purchasing model.

In SAP Business One, when creating a Purchase Order, if the items belong to different warehouses, the system automatically splits the PO into multiple purchase orders (one per warehouse). This is very useful for companies with centralized procurement but distributed warehouses/divisions, as it simplifies receiving and accounting at the warehouse level.

In SAP S/4HANA, I have observed that this functionality is not available by default. Instead, the system allows one PO to contain items for multiple plants/warehouses, and the logistics are handled separately.

👉 My questions are:

  1. Is there a standard option/configuration in S/4HANA to achieve automatic PO split by warehouse/plant (similar to SAP Business One)?

  2. If not standard, what is the recommended best practice for centralized purchasing with bulk discounts and later distribution to different warehouses/divisions?

  3. Is the solution to use Stock Transport Orders (STO) or Central Procurement Hub after creating one bulk PO at the head office?

  4. Has anyone implemented a custom BAdI enhancement (e.g., ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST) to mimic this B1 functionality in S/4HANA?

This is a critical requirement for us since our business negotiates bulk discounts with suppliers and then distributes materials to multiple warehouses.

Any guidance, best practices, or experience sharing will be highly appreciated.

Thanks & Regards,

silambarasan RS

entry.title: Taking and storing snapshots within Datasphere itself
entry.content:
Is there a way to take and store a snapshot of a view within Datasphere?

We have a remote source system upon which we cannot implement real-time replication. We therefore have a schedule to refresh the data periodically.

We then have a series of complex SQL views built on top that produce the models.

We have a requirement to provide a snapshot of the data at 6am each day, which can then be compared to the "live" version on-demand, within the same SAC dashboard.

Is there a way to create an extract from the fact view and store it in a local table based on a task, or another suitable option?
I have searched and came across the following passing comment on learning.sap.com:
"Views transform the data at the moment they are read without storing the result (although storing the view result as a snapshot is possible)", but it doesn't explain how.

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA does not support automatic split purchase...
entry.content: Yes in S/4HANA, the expected option is not available. This behavior is by design, as S/4HANA assumes centralized PO management with decentralized logistics handled via delivery and goods receipt processes. If this auto-split is critical for your operations, explore custom enhancement via BAdI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST

entry.title: 🟢 Evolving data integration with SQL services and CDS external entities
entry.content:
In this session, we’ll present the latest advancements in ABAP Cloud data integration. On the data exposure side, we’ll cover ABAP-managed database procedures for advanced read scenarios and extensions of SQL services to enable data loading scenarios for SQL clients, using CDS writable view entities. On the consumption side, we’ll explore write scenarios, and the use of static CDS external entities for seamless integration of external data into a CDS view stack.

Speakers : Leon Stern and Yannick Rath

entry.title: How to make YCOA and FPA1 available in SAC when integrating with S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
entry.content:
Hi all!

We are implementing SAP Analytics Cloud , integrated with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition , using the Rapid FP&A content.

According to the configuration guide 2JV_S4CLD2508_BB_ConfigGuide_EN_XX, slides 26–35, the default Chart of Accounts (YCOA) and Financial Statement Version (FPA1) should be available in S/4HANA and used in SAC. However, when setting up the SAC import connection, these do not appear as selectable options in the G/L Account dimension import jobs.
  • How can I verify in S/4HANA Cloud that YCOA and FPA1 are correctly activated and configured so they become available for selection in SAC?
    • Where in S/4HANA can I check that YCOA is the active Chart of Accounts
    • How can I confirm that FPA1 is available and properly structured as a Financial Statement Version?

Appreciate any guidance or examples from your implementation!

entry.title: Re: Use of quartile position in SuccessFactors compensation for Compensation Planning
entry.content:
Hi Xavier,

Quartile information is particularly valuable for organizations with large employee populations, where traditional pay range structures may not offer the precision needed for effective compensation planning. These companies often rely on granular market data, segmented into quartiles, to gain deeper insights into competitive pay levels across specific roles, geographies, and industries.

This will Improved equity and budget alignment across departments and regions and the pay decision will be more Data-driven.

entry.title: SAP PO GraphQL Integration with XSLT Mapping
entry.content:
Introduction:

In most SAP projects, integrations are built using REST or OData. But in some cases, modern systems require GraphQL (Graph Query Language), a query language and runtime for APIs that allows clients to request exactly the data they need. When calling a GraphQL service from SAP PO, the service expects application/json, which means we need a transformation step. Using XSLT mapping, we converted the XML request into the JSON format GraphQL understands and executed the call successfully. In this post, I’ll walk you through how we set this up and what we learned along the way.

Note: In this scenario, no authentication was required since the GraphQL service was internal and not exposed externally. However, if the service had been publicly accessible, common security mechanisms such as OAuth 2.0, JWT tokens, or API Keys would typically be implemented. On the SAP PO side, this would be handled by configuring the HTTP/REST adapter to pass the necessary headers (e.g., Authorization: Bearer <token>), ensuring secure communication.

 

Scenario:

Request Example:

Response Example:

 

Step 1: Create Data Type, Message Type , Service Interfaces

Data Type Request:

For this scenario, I defined a dummy field named query. The GraphQL request is embedded into this field and then passed to the target service.

Data Type Response:

You can either create the response message as a Data Type (DT) or convert it into an XSD and import it into PO as an External Definition. I converted it into an XSD and imported it into PO as an External Definition.

Message Type Request :

 

Service Interfaces: 

We also create our Service Interfaces — one inbound and one outbound — and, as usual, place our request and response messages accordingly.

 

 

Step 2: XSLT Mapping 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">

  <xsl:output method="text" encoding="UTF-8"/>

  <xsl:template match="/">

  <xsl:variable name="q1" select="string(/*/*[local-name()='query'])"/>

    <xsl:variable name="q">

      <xsl:choose>

        <xsl:when test="string-length($q1) > 0">

          <xsl:value-of select="$q1"/>

        </xsl:when>

        <xsl:otherwise>

          <xsl:value-of select="string(/*)"/>

        </xsl:otherwise>

      </xsl:choose>

    </xsl:variable>

    <xsl:text>{ "query":"</xsl:text>

    <xsl:call-template name="escape-json">

      <xsl:with-param name="s" select="string($q)"/>

    </xsl:call-template>

    <xsl:text>" }</xsl:text>

  </xsl:template>

  <!-- JSON escape: \  "  LF  CR  TAB -->

  <xsl:template name="escape-json">

    <xsl:param name="s"/>

    <!-- \ -> \\ -->

    <xsl:variable name="step1">

      <xsl:call-template name="replace">

        <xsl:with-param name="text" select="$s"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="search" select="'\'"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="repl" select="'\\'"/>

      </xsl:call-template>

    </xsl:variable>

    <!-- " -> \" (XML için " kullan) -->

    <xsl:variable name="step2">

      <xsl:call-template name="replace">

        <xsl:with-param name="text"   select="string($step1)"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="search" select="'"'"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="repl"   select="'\"'"/>

      </xsl:call-template>

    </xsl:variable>

    <!-- LF, CR, TAB -->

    <xsl:variable name="step3">

      <xsl:call-template name="replace">

        <xsl:with-param name="text" select="string($step2)"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="search" select="'
'"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="repl" select="'\n'"/>

      </xsl:call-template>

    </xsl:variable>

    <xsl:variable name="step4">

      <xsl:call-template name="replace">

        <xsl:with-param name="text" select="string($step3)"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="search" select="''"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="repl" select="'\r'"/>

      </xsl:call-template>

    </xsl:variable>

    <xsl:variable name="step5">

      <xsl:call-template name="replace">

        <xsl:with-param name="text" select="string($step4)"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="search" select="'	'"/>

        <xsl:with-param name="repl" select="'\t'"/>

      </xsl:call-template>

    </xsl:variable>

    <xsl:value-of select="string($step5)"/>

  </xsl:template>

  <!-- basic replace -->

  <xsl:template name="replace">

    <xsl:param name="text"/><xsl:param name="search"/><xsl:param name="repl"/>

    <xsl:choose>

      <xsl:when test="contains($text, $search)">

        <xsl:value-of select="substring-before($text, $search)"/>

        <xsl:value-of select="$repl"/>

        <xsl:call-template name="replace">

          <xsl:with-param name="text" select="substring-after($text, $search)"/>

          <xsl:with-param name="search" select="$search"/>

          <xsl:with-param name="repl" select="$repl"/>

        </xsl:call-template>

      </xsl:when>

      <xsl:otherwise>

        <xsl:value-of select="$text"/>

      </xsl:otherwise>

    </xsl:choose>

  </xsl:template>

</xsl:stylesheet>

 

The purpose of this XSLT mapping is to transform the XML structure coming from SAP into the JSON format required by the GraphQL service. More specifically, it extracts the GraphQL query string from the XML payload and embeds it into the query field of the JSON request body. Without this step, the GraphQL service would not accept the request, since it only supports application/json.

We import the XSLT mapping into PO as an imported archive.

 

 

Step 3 : Message Mappings

If there is no need for a custom graphical mapping, we perform a one-to-one mapping.

 

 

Step 4: Operation Mapping & Test

In the Operation Mapping, we place our one-to-one mapping as the first step, and then add a second step for the XSLT mapping.

We have successfully tested our XSLT mapping. For guidance on sending GraphQL requests with an application/json body, you can refer to the official GraphQL documentation or your server’s implementation guide;

https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/graphql/graphql-http/ 

Test XML : 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<ns0:MT_getFlightLegList_Req xmlns:ns0=********************************>

     <query>

<![CDATA[

Your GraphQL Request

  ]]>

</query>

</ns0:MT_getFlightLegList_Req>

 

 

Step 5: Integrated Configuration

Since PO does not have a GraphQL adapter, we will use REST. We create a standard REST Receiver adapter, and because the call from SAP will come via proxy, our sender is the SOAP XI adapter.

Rest Receiver Data Format Step:

Remember that we’ve converted the payload into the JSON format accepted by the service using XSLT. In other words, our adapter will receive a structure in JSON format.

We create the standard Integrated Configuration (ICO) and activate the scenario.

 

 

Step 6: Testing

You can use Send Message to test.

 

Monitoring:

Request BI Step:

After Mapping Step:

 

Response :

As the response includes personal data, I cannot share it. Nevertheless, this confirms that the request was successfully executed and a response was returned.

 

NOTE: There are scenarios where combining a Message Type with an External Definition in the same Service Interface prevents ABAP proxy generation in SAP. To mitigate this risk, ensure consistency by using the same artifact type (either Message Type or External Definition) on both request and response.

 

Thank you,

Deniz Z.

entry.title: Re: ATC Cloud readiness
entry.content:
Hi @ShiveshS 

Thank you for your question. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Cloudification Repository is the only officially supported source for ATC checks. The system validates the URL, which is why custom SICF services are not permitted. This is also why you received the error when trying to replace the JSON with your own filtered service.

Currently, the CR JSON always delivers the full set of checks. There is no supported way to directly reduce or filter the JSON at source. Instead, the recommended approach is to use the ATC check variant configuration in Eclipse/ADT to control which object categories are checked. This way, you can keep the official repository intact but restrict the checks to only what is relevant to you for example deprecated tables.

I suggest you consider the following recommended Steps:

  • Use the official Cloudification Repository link as delivered by SAP and do not replace it with custom SICF services.
  • Create or adapt a custom ATC check variant in Eclipse/ADT.
  • Within the variant, deactivate the categories you do not need (e.g., BAPIs, FMs) and keep only those relevant for deprecated tables.
  • Run the ATC with your custom variant to focus results specifically on deprecated table usage.

This ensures your checks stay compliant with clean-core extensibility principles while allowing you to narrow the scope to your project’s needs.

For more details, consult the following references:

Cloudification Repository

SAP/abap-atc-cr-cv-s4hc

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Storage location not found for profile R61I error whe...
entry.content:
Hello @ayechan 

The error you mentioned usually means that the storage location determination for the POS profile is not maintained in configuration. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, POS inbound postings require a mapping between POS Profile (R61I in your case), Plant and Storage Location

This happens because, when the system tries to post goods movements from the inbound POS data, it looks up the storage location via the POS profile customizing. If the storage location is missing or not mapped, the system cannot determine where to post the stock.

How to fix it in Public Cloud

  1. Go to Manage Your Solution (SSCUI) → Define Store Profiles and Assign Storage Location.
    • SSCUI ID: 103186, define Store Profile and Assign Storage Location.
  2. Check whether profile R61I has an entry with the correct Plant and Storage Location.
  3. If not, add the assignment so that the POS inbound service can find the storage location.
  4. Thereafter re-run your POS inbound job.

To summarise, the error occurs because the POS profile R61I does not have a storage location assigned in the configuration. Once you maintain the correct plant/storage location mapping for this POS profile in SSCUI 103186, the inbound service will process successfully.

For further details please consult  the references below.

Integration of POS Sales Data with S/4HANA Cloud

API Hub: POS Sales Transactions Create (SAP_COM_0109)

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: BAS on premise deployment errors for recently created...
entry.content:
We run into the same issue and as explained already, an option is to set back the _version to 1.17.0 

The error is not occuring before, because it comes from a change how the manifest.json is created during build process in the dist folder. With the latest versions of the ui5 cli or ux toolings, the single string entry of the i18n property is converted in the dist folder from for example  "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties" to 

"i18n": {
      "bundleUrl": "i18n/i18n.properties",
      "supportedLocales": [
        "en",
        "de",
        "fr"
      ],
      "fallbackLocale": "en"
    }

And if your system is still an R3 with SAPUI5 Version 1.71 this runs into an error, as this fallback handling is only available in 1.77 and higher. We ran into this trap also today and thanks to the initial answers of a possible solution. After our deployment worked I then investigated a bit further to identify the root cause of this error.

entry.title: Re: App Fiori Maintenance Scheduling Board add custom lab...
entry.content:
Hi @DavidLorente 

Thank you for your question.

In the Maintenance Scheduling Board (Gantt Chart) in S/4HANA Public Cloud, the label options you see are fixed to standard fields provided by SAP. Currently, there is no configuration option to add additional custom labels directly to this dropdown list without a custom development.

Here are some options you should consider:

  1. You can add custom fields to maintenance orders or operations. These fields will be visible in the object itself and can be used in reporting. However, CFL does not extend the label list in the Gantt chart by default.
  2. If your requirement is analytical (for display/reporting purposes), you could expose the custom field via CDS view and use it in Fiori analytical apps. But again, this does not extend the label dropdown in the scheduling board.
  3. For UI adaptations, you can check if the Maintenance Scheduling Board allows extensibility (via Adapt UI or UI Flexibility). As of now, SAP restricts such extensions for Gantt charts in Public Cloud, so adding a new label option is not supported.
  4. Since this is a limitation, the only long-term option (without custom development) is to submit it as an influence request to SAP. SAP periodically extends fields available in such dropdowns based on customer feedback.

To summarise, out-of-the-box, you cannot add new labels to the Gantt chart in S/4HANA Public Cloud. Custom fields can be added to orders but won’t appear in the label dropdown. For now, the only path is either SAP influence request or custom extension (if SAP later releases extensibility for this UI).

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: freight cost from sales order to delivery
entry.content:
With standard configuration of having a pricing procedure for delivery, you can achieve this requirement. Follow the below steps

  • Create a manual condition type (e.g., ZFRX) with value 0.01.
  • Include it in both the sales order and delivery pricing procedure.
  • Make it statistical so it doesn’t affect billing or accounting.

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
Hello Akhat,

Unfortunately, the initial idea/useful function of Universal ID is lost after migration.
Please bring this back as this is very important!
To log on, as before Universal ID, every time with a different S-User/Email address is not acceptable.
Imagine a consultant works for AWS, BMW, VW, Pharma1, Pharma2......, there will be one P-User and several S-Users.

Example SAP For Me:
Log on with Universal ID --> Nothing to see because no authorization
                                                       and no longer the select option to go with the user/authorization
                                                       of P-User, S-User A, or S-User B, and so on?
Log on with P-User/Email address  --> Nothing to see because no authorization

Logon with S-User A/Email address A --> Authorization A

Logon with S-User B/Email address B--> Authorization B

Process before with SAP Universal ID:

  1. Log on with SAP Universal ID
  2. Select the linked P or S-User (could be hundreds)

That’s it.

Best Regards
Thomas

entry.title: Can you tell me what authoirzation is missing for this SU53 screenshot
Re: Filter for last event of any case with Signavio Proce...
entry.content:
Hi Benedict, thanks for the question! 

What you are trying to achieve makes total sense, but unfortunately is not yet supported trivially inside of advanced filters. I imagine the error you are receiving is something like "multiple levels of nesting is not supported"? This is because the Event Level filter is already operating on the nested events themselves (not flattened), which restricts it from being able to access to the aggregated information over all events. In short, the event filter can only access attributes associated with the event directly, not aggregates that are calculated over all events.

As a short-term work around, the advice I would give would be to create an case-level attribute inside of your SQL script with the timestamp of the last event per case, re-run the pipeline, and then leverage that case-level attribute inside of an event-level advanced filter. E.g. "case_level_last_end_time_attribute" = "end_time".  

In the coming weeks we will be releasing a new capability that will allow you to create this very case-level attribute with SIGNAL inside the analysis layer directly, which will then also be able to be used as input for the advanced filter. This feature is called "Calculated Attributes", and should support this use case perfectly, as it would calculate the Last event per case in a separate level of query execution, allowing it to be used as input to your advanced filter. If you are interested, we might be able to grant you and your organization early access. Please let us know in this thread 🙂 

Until then, thanks a lot for your question, and sorry that no simply solution is available for you to use. If you have any follow up questions or something is unclear, please don't hesitate to ask!

entry.title: Re: Activating Business Function JFMIP_MM_01 and Switch M...
entry.content:
activating the Business Function JFMIP_MM_01 (via its corresponding switch MRM_SFWS_JFMIP_01) is irreversible. This is because it fundamentally changes the data model and business process for GR/IR account clearing, moving from the classic "value-based" approach to a "quantity-based" approach required by the Fiori app.

The primary "problem" is not an error, but a fundamental and permanent change in your business process and how you handle GR/IR accounts

entry.title: Issue with Capacity Category 001 in Scope Item 31L
entry.content:
Description:
During the execution of the test script for scope item 31L, specifically in the Change Work Center (CR02) app, when trying to modify the standard available capacity for Capacity Category 001 (Machine), the system does not allow editing of the expected values.

According to the test script (see attached screenshot), the following pre-set values should be available:

  • Start time: 07:00:00

  • End time: 16:00:00

  • Length of breaks: 01:00:00

  • Capacity Utilization: 100

  • No. Ind. Capacities: 1

However, in the Starter System of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Capacity Category 001 appears locked and these values are not displayed, showing the following error:

“Do not enter formulas or distribution keys”.

This behavior occurs even when strictly following the steps described in the test script (as seen in the reference image).

Question:
Is this a restriction specific to the Starter System of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, where preconfigured standard capacities cannot be modified, or is there an additional configuration required to enable editing of Capacity Category 001?

Steps - test script 31LCR02

entry.title: Re: Comlemento de Pago de Factoraje con DRC?
entry.content:
Hello @MartinRodriguezG 

Yes, your need can be fulfilled in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud edition through the Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) eDocument solution.

The standard DRC framework for Mexico's Complemento de Pago (Comprobante de Recepción de Pagos or CRP) is intended to accommodate this situation. To add a second payment node in the XML for factoring, you should utilise the extensibility features of the eDocument framework.

How to Set Up the Second Payment Node

Standard Configuration: The default setup in DRC addresses the basic payment complement. For factoring scenarios, where a payment comes from a factor (a different payer than the original customer), this functionality needs to be extended.

Utilise the eDoc_Adaptor BAdI: This Business Add-In (BAdI) is essential for expanding eDocument capabilities. You can add custom logic within this BAdI to.

    • Identify factoring scenarios based on your business rules, for example, a specific clearing account, bank key, or a custom field on the payment document.
    • Obtain the required details for the second payment node from the financial document or a comprehensive data source.
    • Dynamically generate the second <Pago> node in the XML payload, filling it with the details of the factoring payment.

Extensible Fields: The eDocument framework in the public cloud supports extensions via custom fields and APIs. You can add custom fields to the payment document to include specific information needed for the second payment node, which your BAdI implementation can then access.

This method is fully compatible with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and adheres to the Clean Core strategy by utilising the available extensibility framework instead of altering the standard code.

SAP Useful References SAP Help Portal: eDocument solution for Mexico.

SAP Help-Mexico

SAP Community-Process Statuses for eDocuments in Mexico

With kind regards

Chuma
